q:
In Oracle, if you are required to determine the release number of the database server that is currently installed and levels of other components then which of the following SQL queries can you use to perform this action?

SQL Query:

  1. SELECT * FROM PRODUCT_COMPONENT_VERSION;

     

  2. SELECT * FROM ORACLE_VERSION;

     

  3. SELECT * FROM PRODUCT_VERSION;

     

  4. SELECT * FROM V$VERSION;
In PL/SQL, which of the following events cannot be customized with triggers?

a.option: CREATE TABLE statement in a schema

q:
In PL/SQL, what is the END_DATE in the following trigger header:

TRIGGER TRACK_MODIFICATION
AFTER UPDATE OF END_DATE ON ORDER_PURCHASE
In PL/SQL, which of the following program units share the same namespace?

a.option: Stored packages in one schema and stored procedures in another schema
Stored procedures and functions within the same schema

q:
Based on the following code, what is the output of the PL/SQL query:

Code

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION welcome_hck(p_name IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN VARCHAR2
IS
BEGIN
RETURN('Welcome'||p_name);
END;

DECLARE
lv_msg VARCHAR2(250);
BEGIN
lv_msg:=welcome_hck('HackerEarth');
dbms_output.put_line(lv_msg);
END;

Query

SELECT welcome_hck('HackerEarth') FROM DUAL;

Determine the output of the PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        x NUMBER := Null;
        y NUMBER := 67;
BEGIN
        IF x != y THEN  
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('x != y'); 
        ELSIF x = y THEN 
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('x = y');
        ELSE
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE
                        ('Welcome to HackerEarth');
        END IF;
END;

"""What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        counter INTEGER; 
BEGIN
        counter := counter + 1;  
        IF counter IS NULL THEN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hi HackerEarth.');
        END IF;
            DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hi PL/SQL.');
END;

What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        "HELLO" varchar2(10) := 'hello';  
        "BEGIN" varchar2(10) := 'begin';  
BEGIN
        DBMS_Output.Put_Line(Hello);    
        DBMS_Output.Put_Line(BEGIN);
end;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        n SIMPLE_INTEGER := 19;
BEGIN
        FOR j IN 1..3 LOOP
                n := n + -(-(-7));
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(TO_CHAR(n, 'S99'));
        END LOOP;
        FOR j IN 1..-2 LOOP
            n := n - 1;
            DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(TO_CHAR(n, 'S99'));
        END LOOP;
END;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DROP TABLE t;
CREATE TABLE t (c CHAR(3 CHAR));
DECLARE
        s VARCHAR2(5 CHAR) := 'abc';
BEGIN
        INSERT INTO t(c) VALUES(s);
END;

What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        p  VARCHAR2(30);
        n  PLS_INTEGER := 2+1*4;
BEGIN
        FOR j in 2..ROUND(SQRT(n)) LOOP
                IF n MOD j = 0 THEN
                        p := ' is not a prime number';
                        GOTO print_now;
                END IF;
        END LOOP;
        p := ' is a prime number';
        <>
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(TO_CHAR(n) || p);
END;
In PL/SQL, you are working on the collection types. Determine the lower bound of the index of the VARRAY collection type?

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE  
        TYPE hack_type1 IS VARRAY(4) OF VARCHAR2(15); 
        hackvar1 hack_type1;                               
        TYPE hack_type2 IS TABLE OF VARCHAR2(15);        
        hackvar2 hack_type2 := hack_type2('Alice', 'Bob');    
BEGIN
        IF hackvar1 IS NULL THEN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('hackvar1 is NULL');
        ELSE
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('hackvar1 is not NULL');
        END IF;
        IF hackvar2 IS NOT NULL THEN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('hackvar2 is not NULL');
        ELSE
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('hackvar2 is NULL');
        END IF;
END;

a.option:
hackvar1 is NULL
hackvar2 is NULL

hackvar1 is not NULL
hackvar2 is not NULL

hackvar1 is NULL
hackvar2 is not NULL

hackvar1 is not NULL
hackvar2 is NULL

q: In PL/SQL, you are working on static SQL statements. You have created a table sequence. After a sequence is created, you can access its values in SQL statements with the NEXTVAL pseudo column, which increments the sequence and returns the new value. You are referencing the sequence_name.NEXTVAL to increment the sequence. You have tried to roll back the transaction and you found it failed. Which of the following statements are responsible for this failure of rollback?

a.option: Each time you reference sequence_name.NEXTVAL, the sequence is incremented immediately.
Each time you reference sequence_name.NEXTVAL, the sequence is incremented immediately and permanently.

q: In PL/SQL, you are working on the cursors. If an explicit cursor is not open, then which of the following predefined exception is raised by the explicit cursor attribute %ROWCOUNT?
In PL/SQL, which of the following statements ends the current transaction by making the permanent changes and visible to other users?

In PL/SQL, you are declaring the cursor variable as a formal parameter of a subprogram. If the subprogram only fetches from the cursor variable, which of the following can be the parameter modes:
1. IN
2. OUT
3. IN OUT

In PL/SQL, you are processing the query result by handling the large multiple-row result sets. If you are required to assign the large quantity of the table data to the variables, then which of the following clauses must be used along with the SELECT INTO statement?

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE Definition IS RECORD (
                hackvar1     VARCHAR2(20),
                hackvar2  VARCHAR2(200)
        );
        TYPE Hacktype IS VARRAY(2000) OF Definition;
        hackvar3  Hacktype := Hacktype();  
        PROCEDURE hackprocedure (
                hacklist IN OUT NOCOPY Hacktype  
        ) IS
        BEGIN
                hacklist(1).hackvar1 := 'Hello HackerEarth!';
        END;
BEGIN
        hackvar3.EXTEND;
        hackvar3(1).hackvar1 := 'Welcome to PL/SQL!';
        hackprocedure(hackvar3);  
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(hackvar3(1).hackvar1);
END;

In PL/SQL, you are working on the error handling. Which of the following statements about the internally defined exception are correct:
1. It does not have a name unless either PL/SQL gives it one .
2. The syntax to associate the name with the error code of the internally defined exception is PRAGMA EXCEPTION_INIT (error_code)
3. The exception_name EXCEPTION syntax is used to declare the exception

In PL/SQL, you are working on the correlation names and the pseudo records in the triggers. Which of the following statements about the restrictions on the pseudo records are correct:
1. A pseudo record always must be contained in a record-level operation.
2. A pseudo record cannot be an actual subprogram parameter.
3. If the triggering statement is DELETE, then the trigger cannot change NEW field values.
4. An AFTER trigger cannot change NEW field values, because the triggering statement runs before the trigger fires.

You have created a stored procedure called ADD_CUSTOMERS which contains an INSERT statement for a table called CUSTOMERS. After the procedure is created successfully, you ALTER the CUSTOMERS table by dropping a column from the table.However this column is not referenced in the procedure. What must be done to make sure that the procedure has a VALID status?

You have created a PL/SQL clock that declares variables using the %TYPE feature. When you created the block, the column upon which you based the %TYPE had declaration of datatype of NUMBER, but since you first created the block, it has been altered to have datatype of VARCHAR2. Which of the following system defined exceptions is most likely to occur in your block now without modification.

In PL/SQL, you have created a new function with the following header and declaration section:

FUNCTION EMPLOYEE_JOINING_DATE
(p_emp_id IN NUMBER)
RETURN DATE
IS
v_emp_join_date DATE;
BEGIN


Which of these statements is not accepted by the compiler for this function?
In PL/SQL, which of the following packages lets you send information directly into the program unit of another user’s login session without communicating directly with the database?

You have created an PL/SQL procedure with the following header:

Procedure ASSIGNMENT(ASSIGNMENT_DATE OUT DATE);


Assuming that the referenced variable is declared correctly, which of the following is a valid call to the procedure?

Consider the following PL/SQL code:

PACKAGE accounting AS
ex_overbooked EXCEPTION;
END accounting;


The exception accounting.ex_overbooked is a ______________________.
In Oracle, which of these statements is used to enable SQL trace for a session within a PL/SQL package?
In Oracle, which of the following states allows only DBA transactions, queries, fetches, or PL/SQL statements within a database?
In Oracle, which of these commands is used to create a backup control file?

a.option: ALTER DATABASE BACKUP TRACE TO CONTROLFILE
CREATE TABLE BACKUP_TABLE AS ALTER * FROM TABLE_TO_BE_BACKUP
ALTER DATABASE BACKUP CONTROLFILE TO TRACE

q:
In Oracle, which of the following are the roles of a database administrator(DBA):

  1. Manage database storage
  2. Administer users and security
  3. Manage schema objects
  4. Monitor and manage database performance
  5. Perform backup and recovery
  6. Schedule and automate jobs
In Oracle, which of the following user interfaces is used to provide BI data to the web clients?
Which of the following Oracle BI hierarchies does not have the same depth?

Which of the following represents the correct order of creating business models on the Oracle BI server:

  1. Creating business models
  2. Defining logical joins
  3. Creating logical tables and mapping them to physical tables
  4. Creating logical columns

Which of the following statements about the Oracle BI server is correct:

  1. It is a query engine that converts physical SQL statements into logical requests in order to execute the statements in data sources
  2. It is a query engine that converts logical requests into physical SQL statements in order to execute the requests in data sources
  3. It is a query engine that converts physical requests into logical SQL statements in order to execute the requests in data sources
In Oracle, which of the following types of data warehouses contains less number of transactions and complex calculations?

​​​​​​In Oracle, which of the following statements about data warehouses are correct:

  1. It is used for reporting and data analysis
  2. It provides a central repository containing data that are integrated from multiple resources
  3. It does not store current and historical data
In Oracle BI, which of the following security permissions is implemented on objects such as dashboards, KPIs, etc.?
Which of the following are the modules of the Oracle ERM software?
In Oracle, which of the following privileges is mandatory to access the database in a restricted mode?
In Oracle, which of the following statements about the TRUNCATE table_name command is incorrect?

a.option: It is a DDL statement, hence it cannot be rolled back.
It does not affect any structures associated with the table that is getting truncated or authorized.
If a user has the DROP ANY TABLE system privilege,then he or she can truncate a table or cluster in any schema.
A TRUNCATE statement deletes rows from a table therefore, triggers associated with the table are not deleted.

q: In Oracle, which of the following packages is used to collect statistics about the physical storage characteristics of a table, index, or cluster?
In Oracle, which of the following packages is used to detect and repair corrupt blocks in tables and indexes?

In Oracle, which of the following profiles allows a user to have a maximum of four failed login attempts and lock their account for a period of 30 days after exceeding the maximum failed login attempts?
In Oracle, if the AUDIT_TRAIL parameter is set to OS, then which of the following statements is incorrect?

a.option: The Windows operating system writes audit records as events to the application event log.
You are not allowed to specify the AUDIT_FILE_DEST initialization parameter for Windows platforms.

In some operating systems, an audit record for instance connection and database startup is always logged to the default location $ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/audit regardless of the setting of AUDIT_FILE_DEST parameter.
There is no default value for initializing AUDIT_FILE_DEST parameter.

q: In Oracle, how many customer groups are specified while creating a simple plan by using the DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.CREATE_SIMPLE_PLAN package?
In Oracle, which of the following roles is invalid for a node participating in a distributed transaction?
In Oracle, which of the following commands cannot be executed successfully?

a.option: grant all on table@db_link to user

q: In Oracle, which of the following types of links is not a valid type of database link?
In Oracle, which of the following statements best defines a heterogeneous database system?

a.option: A distributed database system in which all databases are Oracle databases working on different operating systems.
A distributed database system in which both Oracle and non oracle databases are equal in number.
A distributed database system in which at least one of the databases is a non-Oracle database.
A distributed database system in which all databases are Oracle databases working on different versions.

q: In Oracle, the NOLOGGING clause is specified in the CREATE TABLE command. Which of the following statements about the performance improvement is correct?

a.option: Greater for larger tables compared to smaller tables
Greater for smaller tables compared to larger tables

q: In Oracle, if the TABLESPACE clause is not specified in the CREATE TABLE command, then which of the following statements is incorrect?

a.option: The table is created in the default tablespace.
There is a significant increase in the time needed for database administration.
The performance of the database system is adversely impacted.

q: In Oracle, which of the following queries returns the name of each rollback segment with the tablespace that contains the segment and its size?
In Oracle, which of the following statements displays the free space in the tabsp_4 tablespace?

a.option:
SELECT  BLOCK_ID, BYTES, BLOCKS 
FROM  DBA_FREE_SPACE
WHERE TABLESPACE_NAME = 'tblspc_02'
ORDER BY BLOCK_ID;

SELECT  BLOCK_ID, BYTES, BLOCKS 
FROM  DBA_FREE_TAABLESPACE
WHERE TABLESPACE_NAME = 'tblspc_02'
ORDER BY BLOCK_ID;

SELECT  BLOCK_ID, BYTES, BLOCKS 
FROM  DBA_UNUSED_SPACE
WHERE TABLESPACE_NAME = 'tblspc_02'
ORDER BY BLOCK_ID;

SELECT  BLOCK_ID, BYTES, BLOCKS 
FROM  DBA_UNUSED_TABLESPACE
WHERE TABLESPACE_NAME = 'tblspc_02'
ORDER BY BLOCK_ID;

q: In Oracle, what is the smallest extent size possible when the AUTOALLOCATE clause is used to CREATE TABLESPACE command?

In Oracle, if the EXTENT MANAGEMENT LOCAL attribute is explicitly specified in the CREATE TABLESPACE command, then the TEMPORARY clause cannot be specified. Which of the following commands is used to create a temporary, locally managed tablespace?
In Oracle, which of the following views is used to obtain information about a shared server configuration and monitor performance?
In Oracle, which of the following initialization parameters that control the shared server is mandatory?

In Oracle, the UNDO_MANAGEMENT=AUTO clause is used in the CREATE_DATABASE command to operate the database in the automatic undo management mode. Which of the following statements about this mode is correct?

a.option: In this mode, the rollback information is stored in an undo tablespace.
In this mode, the undo information is stored in rollback segments.
In this mode, the rollback information redo segments.
In this mode, the undo information is stored in a tablespace of a user.

q: In Oracle, if the release number is 10.3.0.1.0, then what is the significance of the number 3?
In Oracle, what is the sum value of the PCTUSED and PCTFREE parameters?

a.option: Less than the size of the data block

q: In Oracle, which of the following methods is not recommended to handle large tables?

a.option: Separating a table from its indexes
Specifying the UNLIMITED keyword for the MAXEXTENTS parameter
Creating a table and its index in the same tablespace

q: In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to create a temporary table temp_tab?
In Oracle, which of the following initialization parameters is used to decrease the length of a non-empty char column?
In Oracle, which of the following conditions is mandatory to create a database with a locally managed SYSTEM tablespace?

a.option: There must be a default temporary tablespace and that tablespace cannot be the SYSTEM tablespace.
Rollback segments should not be created in dictionary-managed tablespaces.

q: In Oracle, generic users apart from common ones like SYS and SYSTEM are available in the system depending on the installed options and features. Which of the following is a generic user for the Enterprise Manager Intelligent agent?
In Oracle, which of the following commands opens a database in the read-only mode?
In Oracle, which of the following data dictionary views is used to monitor locks?
In Oracle, the initialization parameter file for the mynewdb database is initmynewdb.ora. What is the default locaation of this file?
In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to modify domain in a global database name?

a.option:
update V$PARAMETER
set VALUE = "database.domain"
where name = 'db_domain'
ALTER DATABASE RENAME GLOBAL_NAME TO database.domain;

q: In Oracle, which of the following processes is used to manage resources and provide an inter-instance resource control?
In Oracle, which of the following is used to perform administrative tasks?

a.option: Creating additional administrator user and granting it the role of DBA

q: In Oracle, which of the following parameters is altered in the ALTER ROLLBACK SEGMENT command to shrink a rollback segment?
In Oracle, which of the following tasks cannot be performed by using the ALTER TABLE command?

a.option: Moving the table to a new segment or tablespace
Modifying the CACHE or NOCACHE attribute
Modifying the degree of parallelism for the table

q: In Oracle, which of the following initialization parameters is used to control the location and size of the trace file?
In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to disable the AUDIT statement?
In Oracle, if an object is dropped and re-created, then which of the following statements about its privilege is correct?

a.option: It has to be revoked before dropping an object, else the DROP command will return an error.
If the object is created immediately after implementing the DROP command, then it is automatically re-granted.

q: In Oracle, which of the following parameters cannot be modified by using the ALTER_SYSTEM command?
In Oracle, which of the following views is used to list all the in-doubt distributed transactions?
In Oracle, if us.americas.warehouse.com is a network domain, then what is the valid global database name of the inventory database present in the network domain?
In Oracle, which of the following files is not created when the database is in the NOARCHIVELOG mode?
In Oracle, what happens if you try to perform a crash recovery of a database and one of the data files is in the backup mode and an attempt is made to open it?

a.option: The database opens without this data file
The database opens without any of the data files
The database opens and closes immediately

q: In Oracle, which of the following views is queried to check whether a data file is part of a current online tablespace backup?

Suppose an Oracle database gets backed up inconsistently on a daily basis. One fine day, the database crashes and you need to recover the database. The archive log files were getting backed up with log numbers from 100 to 180 on the day the database crashed.

Using the RMAN backup, you have recovered the database, and the next step is to recover it until the most recent log (i.e. archive log number 180). However, you find that archive log file number 175 is missing.

Which of these will be your next step?

a.option: The database can be recovered only until log 174
The database can be recovered until log 180 but data in log 175 will be lost
The archive logs cannot be restored at all
The archive log file can be recovered by undoing the recent SCN

q:
Which of the following commands is valid for ARCHIVE LOG backup?

a) The BACKUP ARCHIVELOG command

b) The BACKUP ... PLUS ARCHIVELOG command

c) An O/S utility

In Oracle, which of the following commands are valid for backing up a control file:

a) The backup current controlfile command

b) ALTER DATABASE BACKUP CONTROLFILE

c) ALTER DATABASE BACKUP CONTROLFILE TO TRACE

An airlines company that should operate 24 hours a day depends on an Oracle database that must run continuously. However, the data in the tablespace is very volatile and must be backed up frequently.

Which of the following commands sets the tablespace in the backup mode?

In Oracle, you have created a stored procedure DELETE_TEST_TABLE that uses dynamic SQL to remove a table in your schema. You have granted the EXECUTE privilege to user ANN on this procedure. When the user XYZ executes the DELETE_TEST_TABLE procedure, under whose privileges are the operations performed by default?

a.option: User XYZ cannot execute your procedure that has dynamic SQL

q: In Oracle, there is an employee table in a schema which has a public synonym EMP and you are granted all object privileges on it. The employee information which is in the public synonym EMP table is been processed by your procedure proc_emp. You have just created a new table called employee within your schema. Which of the following statements is correct?

a.option: If the structure of your employee table is entirely different from the public synonym EMP table, then the procedure proc_emp successfully recompiles and accesses your employee table.
If the structure of your employee table is the same as the public synonym EMP then the procedure proc_emp successfully recompiles when invoked and accesses your employee table.
Creating the table has no effect and procedure proc_emp still accesses data from public synonym EMP table.
If the structure of your employee table is the same as the public synonym EMP table then the procedure proc_emp is invalidated and gives compilation error.

q: In Oracle, what is the appropriate table used to perform arithmetic calculations using MATH functions, on values defined within the SELECT statement?

a.option: The table containing the column values.

q:
In Oracle, which of the following can be achieved using the SQL loader:

  1. Load data from multiple data files during the same load session
  2. Load data into multiple tables during the same load session
  3. Generate primary key values in all columns.
  4. Manipulate the data before loading it, using SQL functions
Suppose you have a production database which must continue to run 24 hours a day and 7 days a week. Which of the following is used for a consistent backup?

a.option: A backup after every SCN can be considered consistent
A backup after every COMMIT can be considered consistent
A full backup every night at 12 mid night can be considered complete
A database in this scenario can never be consistently backed up

q: In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to increase the product_type column which is declared as varchar2(10), to varchar2(15) in the SALES table?

a.option: ALTER TABLE sales SET UNUSED COLUMN product_type VARCHAR2;
ALTER TABLE sales MODIFY product_type VARCHAR2;
ALTER TABLE sales DROP COLUMN product_type;

q: In Oracle, which of the following data dictionaries is queried to verify if the UPDATE privileges have been granted?

a.option: This requires join of two views

q: Your application requirement is to get the value of a parameter associated with the context namespace. Your developer mentions that sys_context can be used. However, you want to use global variables. Which approach is better and why?

a.option: Use of global variables is better because its scope lasts throughout the session
Use of sys_context is better because it is dynamic and can be used in Sql too
Either of them should not make any difference

q:
In Oracle, if a role is a group of privileges assigned a name, what is the output of the following command: 

create role public;

a.option: Executes successfully but role does not get created

q: How do you provide a hint to a query in an existing application when you have only the binary?

a.option: This is not possible at all
Using a LOGON trigger to execute the application
Using the Rule-based mechanism for tuning

q: In Oracle, if a metric reaches its predetermined alert, then which of the following statements is true?

a.option: The database shuts down but the OEM will continue to run
An alert is generated and OEM shuts down

q: When OEM finds an Oracle instance with an insufficient number of control file copies, it __________________________________.
In OEM, alerts are automatically generated by checking the monitored condition. How often does this check occurs?

a.option: Depends on a parameter set already

q:
In Oracle, which of the following queries will you use to find the space occupied by the table T?

1) select segment_name,bytes from dba_segments where segment_name=‘T’

2) select segment_name, bytes from dba_extents where segment_name=‘T’

3) select segment_name,bytes from dba_spaces where segment_name=‘T’

In Oracle, consider 5 users, U1 to U5. Suppose user-privileges are granted in the following manner:

U1 → U2 → U3 → U4 → U5

When privilege is revoked from U3, what would happen to U4 & U5?

a.option: U4 and U5 will keep the privileges
U4 and U5 will lose the privileges
U4 will keep the privileges and U5 will lose the privileges
U5 will keep the privileges and U4 will lose the privileges

q: You have a database with the us7ascii character set. In this database you cannot store characters like ñ. For example, the word “niño” will be stored like ni?o. You have another database with the WE8ISO8859P1 character set. You are doing an export/import from db (us7ascii) to database WE8ISO8859P1. Will this resolve the problem (i. e., will Oracle preserve the data by converting datatype appropriately)?

a.option: Oracle implicitly converts the datatype and hence data will show properly in the new database.
The data must be explicitly converted after an import.
The data must be explicitly converted after an import.
The data will remain the same—it will still be ni?o since it is stored with 7-bit in the US7ASCII database. The 8-bit database will not add the extra bit.

q: In Oracle, which of the following parameters must be provided while executing export and import commands?
In Oracle, which of the following privileges is required to create a database?
In Oracle, which of the following data dictionaries is queried to verify if the UPDATE privileges have been granted?

a.option: This requires join of two views

q:
In Oracle, which of the following statements about profiles is true?

A. Profiles can control the use of passwords.

B. Profile-assignments do not affect current sessions.

C. All the limits of the DEFAULT profile are initially unlimited.

D. Profiles can be assigned to users and roles, but cannot be assigned to other profiles.

E. Profiles can ensure that the users log off the database when they have left their session idle for a period of time.

You issue the following queries to obtain information about the redo log files. 

SQL>SELECT group#, type, member FROM v$logfile;

GROUP#  TYPE   MEMBER
1       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u02/log1a.rdo
1       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u03/log1b.rdo
2       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u02/log2a.rdo
2       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u03/log2b.rdo
3       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u02/log3a.rdo
3       ONLINE /databases/DB01/ORADATA/u03/log3b.rdo

SQL>SELECT group#, sequence#, status FROM v$log;

GROUP#  SEQUENCE#  STATUS
1       250        INACTIVE
2       251        CURRENT
3       249        INACTIVE

You immediately issue this command:



ALTER DATABASE DROP LOGFILE MEMBER “/databases/DB01/ORADATA/u03/log2b.rdo”;
Why does the command fail?

a.option: Each online redo log file group must have two members.
You cannot delete any members of online redo log file groups.
You cannot delete any members of the current online redo log file group.
You must delete the online redo log file in the operating system before issuing the ALTER DATABASE command.

q: In Oracle, which one of the following actions causes a log switch?

a.option: When an instance is shut down
When the current online redo log file group is filled

q: In Oracle, which of these is the background process which performs a checkpoint in the DB by writing modified or updated blocks from the database buffer cache to the data files in the System Global Area?
In Oracle, you are exploring a background process to trace the files for your LGWR process. In which of the following scenarios will you find a trace file generated for this process?

a.option: When Oracle cannot write to the alert log file
When specially requested by the user

q:
You are in the middle of a transaction and very crucial data has been modified. Due to the hardware failure, the instance has shut down before synchronizing all the database files. Which of the following statements is correct?

  1. On startup, use RMAN to perform instance recovery.
  2. On startup, SMON coordinates instance recovery. 3 On startup, CKPT coordinates instance recovery. 4 .Uncommitted changes will be rolled back after the database is opened.
  3. On startup, perform media recovery and then instance recovery
  4. On startup, all the files will be synchronized and you will get both committed and uncommitted data.
In Oracle, which of the following dynamic data dictionary views will you query to find out the names of the data files associated with a tablespace to take its online backup?
Which one of the following is not a physical structure that constitutes the Oracle database?
In Oracle, the temporary tablespaces should be locally managed and uniform size should be a multiple of the ________________________.

Execute below SQL Statements:

SQL>delete from employee;

There are no other uncommitted transactions on the SALES table. Which of the following is true about the DELETE statement?

a.option: It removes all the rows in the table and deleted rows cannot be rolled back
It removes all the rows as well as the structure of the table
It removes all the rows in the table and deleted rows can be rolled back
It would not remove the rows if the table has a primary key

q:
John is executing UPDATE statement on the EMPLOYEE table as follows:

SQL>UPDATE hr.employee set salary = salary + 10 where employee_id = 1;

John is not issuing a commit statement and after 3 minutes, Bob is executing the UPDATE statement on the EMPLOYEE table as follows:

SQL>UPDATE hr.employee set salary = salary + 20 where employee_id = 1;

Which of the following statements is true about the given scenario?

a.option: John's UPDATE statement is executed successfully and the salary which is updated for the employee_id 1 is saved successfully in database
Bob's UPDATE Statement gives you an ORA-error
Bob's UPDATE statement is in waiting and will execute once the commit command is issued by John
Bob's UPDATE statement is executed successfully and the salary which is updated for the employee_id 1 is saved successfully in database

What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        PROCEDURE p
        IS
                x VARCHAR2(1);
        BEGIN
                x := 'a'; 
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hello world!');
        END;
        PROCEDURE q
        IS
                x VARCHAR2(1);
        BEGIN
                x := 'b'; 
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('I love PL/SQL');
        END;
BEGIN
        p;
        q;
END;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

BEGIN
        FOR i IN 1..3 LOOP
                IF i < 3 THEN
                        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (TO_CHAR(i));
                ELSE
                        i := 2;
                END IF;
        END LOOP;
END;

What is the output of the PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE hack_type IS TABLE OF PLS_INTEGER INDEX BY PLS_INTEGER;
        n  PLS_INTEGER := 5;   
        sn PLS_INTEGER := 10;  
        m  PLS_INTEGER := 3;   
        FUNCTION hack_function (
                var1 IN PLS_INTEGER,
                var2 IN PLS_INTEGER
        ) RETURN hack_type
        IS
                s hack_type;
        BEGIN
                FOR i IN 1..var2 LOOP
                        s(i) := var1 * ((i * (i + 1)) / 2);  
                END LOOP;
                RETURN s;
        END hack_function;
BEGIN
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE (
                'The value of hackid ' || TO_CHAR(n) || ' with hackvalue ' ||
                TO_CHAR(m) || ' is ' || TO_CHAR(hack_function (m, sn)(n))
        );
END;

a.option: The value of hackid 3 with hackvalue 9 is 27
The value of hackid 5 with hackvalue 3 is 45
The value of hackid 7 with hackvalue 2 is 14
The value of hackid 10 with hackvalue 4 is 36

q: In PL/SQL, you are working on the collection types. You are given a hash table as a non-PL/SQL composite type. If you are required to translate this composite type to the PL/SQL collection type, then determine the equivalent PL/SQL composite type in this scenario?

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE hacktype1 IS TABLE OF INTEGER INDEX BY VARCHAR2(10);
        hack_var1  hacktype1;
        PROCEDURE hack_procedure IS
        BEGIN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Key = ' || hack_var1.LAST);
        END hack_procedure;
BEGIN
        hack_var1('Z') := 26;
        hack_var1('A') := 11;
        hack_var1('K') := 56;
        hack_var1('R') := 12;
        hack_var1.DELETE('A');
        hack_var1.DELETE('R');
        hack_procedure;
END;

TRIGGER MEMBERS_AUDIT
BEFORE UPDATE ON MEMBERS

BEGIN
:NEW.UPDATE_DATE := SYSDATE;
:NEW.UPDATE_USER := USER;
END;

q:
Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        s  PLS_INTEGER := 0;
        i  PLS_INTEGER := 0;
        j  PLS_INTEGER;
BEGIN
        <>
        LOOP
                i := i + 1;
                j := 0;
                <>
                LOOP
                        j := j + 1;
                        s := s + i * j;
                        EXIT inner_loop WHEN (j > 4);
                        EXIT outer_loop WHEN ((i * j) > 10);
                END LOOP inner_loop;
        END LOOP outer_loop;
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE
                ('My value is: ' || TO_CHAR(s));
END;

DECLARE
        TYPE tb1 IS TABLE OF VARCHAR2(20);

        TYPE ntb1 IS TABLE OF tb1; 
        vntb1 ntb1 := ntb1(vtb1);
        TYPE tv1 IS VARRAY(10) OF INTEGER;  
        TYPE ntb2 IS TABLE OF tv1;          
        vntb2 ntb2 := ntb2(tv(3,5), tv1(5,7,3));
BEGIN
        vntb1.EXTEND;
        vntb1(2) := vntb1(1);
        vntb1.DELETE(1);

What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE t1 IS VARRAY(10) OF INTEGER;  
        va t1 := t1(2,3,5);
        TYPE nt1 IS VARRAY(10) OF t1;      
        nva nt1 := nt1(va, t1(55,6,73), t1(2,4), va);
        i INTEGER;
        va1 t1;
BEGIN
        i := nva(2)(3);
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Value = ' || i);
        nva.EXTEND;
        nva(5) := t1(56, 32);          
        nva(4) := t1(45,43,67,43345);  
        nva(4)(4) := 1;                
        nva(4).EXTEND;    
        nva(4)(5) := 89;  
END;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE Arr_Type IS VARRAY(10) OF NUMBER;
        hackvar1 Arr_Type := Arr_Type();
BEGIN
        hackvar1.EXTEND(4);
        hackvar1(1) := 10;
        hackvar1(2) := 20;
        hackvar1(3) := 30;
        hackvar1(4) := 40;
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(NVL(hackvar1.prior (3400), -1));
END;

In PL/SQL, you are working on the cursors. If an explicit cursor query includes a virtual column, then which of the following conditions must be true such that the column must have an alias feature:
1. The cursor is used to fetch into a record that was declared with %ROWTYPE.
2. The cursor is used to store the session record that was invoked with %ROW_SIZE.

In PL/SQL, you are working on the cursors. Which of the following statements about the explicit cursor are correct:
1. This cursor is defined and declared by giving it a name and associating it with a query.
2. This cursor is used in a cursor FOR LOOP statement to process the query result set.
3. A value cannot be assigned to this cursor by using the value as in expression.

In PL/SQL, which of the following statements about the autonomous transactions are correct:
1. This is an independent transaction started by the main transaction.
2. The autonomous routine commits a minimum of three autonomous transactions namely AT1, AT2, and AT3.
3. It performs the SQL operations and commit or rollback, without committing or rolling back the main transaction.

In PL/SQL, which of the following statements are allowed in the read-only transaction:
1. FETCH
2. DROP
3. OPEN
4. LOCK TABLE

In PL/SQL, you are working on the triggers. Which of the following statements about the Compound DML trigger are correct:
1. It is created on a non-editioning view that is not really compound.
2. It can be conditional and autonomous.
3. It is used to accumulate rows destined for a second table so that you can periodically bulk-insert the rows.
4. It is used to avoid mutating-table error (ORA-04091).

In PL/SQL, you are working on the triggers. Which of the following statements about the INSTEAD OF DML triggers are correct:
1. It is a DML trigger created on a non-editioning view.
2. An INSTEAD OF trigger is the only way to update a view that is inherently updatable.
3. An INSTEAD OF trigger can read OLD and NEW values, but cannot change them.
4. An INSTEAD OF trigger with the NESTED TABLE clause fires only if the triggering statement operates on the elements of the specified nested table column of the view.

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        hackvar1 NUMBER := 9.73;
        hackvar2 NUMBER := 2;
        hackvar3 NUMBER;
BEGIN
        hackvar3 := hackvar1 / hackvar2+hackvar1*hackvar2;  
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('My value = ' || hackvar3);
EXCEPTION
        WHEN ZERO_DIVIDE THEN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Invalid values.');
                hackvar3 := NULL;
END;

In PL/SQL, you are working on the packages. If the Oracle Database instantiates a package, then which of the following actions are required to initialize the package:
1. Assigning initial values to public and private constants.
2. Assigning initial values to public variables
3. Executing the initialization part of the package body

In PL/SQL, you are working on the triggers. If two or more triggers with different timing points are defined for the same statement on the same table, then which of the following sequences of steps about the order in which trigger fires is correct:
1. All BEFORE STATEMENT triggers
2. All AFTER STATEMENT triggers
3. All BEFORE EACH ROW triggers
4. All AFTER EACH ROW triggers

In PL/SQL, you are working on the triggers. Which of the following statements about the Compound DML trigger restrictions are correct:
1. Only the BEFORE EACH ROW section can change the value of the PARENT statement.
2. A timing-point section cannot handle exceptions raised in another timing-point section.
3. If a timing-point section includes a GOTO statement, then the target of the GOTO statement must be in the same timing-point section.
In PL/SQL, which of the following can be included in the RETURN statement of a cursor statement?

a.option: A set of variables in the same order of the columns as mentioned in the SELECT statement
A set of variables in any order having the same number of columns as mentioned in the SELECT statement

q: In Oracle, which of the following views is used to display the currently active plans?

UPDATE scott.dept@prod.au.comany.com
SET loc = 'ROSEWOOD STORES'
WHERE deptno = 40;
UPDATE scott.bldg@retail.au.comany.com
SET room = 1230
WHERE room = 1163;
COMMIT;
In Oracle, which of the following data dictionary views is used to list information about unused columns?

In Oracle, the following command is used to create rollback segments:

CREATE ROLLBACK SEGMENT

Which of these is the best practice to create rollback segments?

a.option: Rollback segments do not require any tablespaces
Use the same tablespace as that of a transactional tablespace
Allow Oracle to choose the tablespace
Use a seperate tablespace different from a transactional tablespace

q: Oracle makes the control files and data files consistent to the same SCN during a database ________________________.

Suppose you are trying to perform RMAN backup. There are three data files: 1, 2 and 3. In file 1, Oracle reads the 10th block and finds that this block is fragmented and hence does not provide consistent information. What does RMAN do?

a.option: It skips this block and reads the 11th block
It reloads the block until correct information is available
It backups the block as it is

q:
The following query has been issued in a SQL Plus session.

 SELECT name,age,country FROM contestant
 WHERE (country,age) = (SELECT country,MIN FROM contestant GROUP BY country);

Which of the following is used to identify both the type of query and the expected result from the Oracle database?

a.option: Multiple-column subquery;Oracle will return an error because '=' should replace 'IN'
Multiple–column subquery, the youngest contestant from all countries
Multiple-row subquery, the youngest contestant from all countries
Single-row subquery, the youngest contestant from one country

q:
You have executed the following command in the recovery manager (RMAN) to perform a backup of the DATA tablespace: 

RMAN> BACKUP TABLESPACE DATA;
Under which of the following conditions will this command execute successfully?

  1. The database is in the NOMOUNT state.
  2. The database is in the ARCHIVELOG mode and tablespace is online.
  3. The database is in the ARCHIVELOG mode and the tablespace is offline.
  4. The database is in the NOARCHIVELOG mode and tablespace is online.
  5. The database is in the NOARCHIVELOG mode and tablespace is offline.
Which of the following statements about associated columns and datatypes is not true in Oracle?

a.option: When creating referential integrity constraints between two tables, the datatype of the referenced column in the parent table must be identical to the referencing column in the child.
When creating record variables designed to hold a row's worth of data, each element's datatype in the record must be large enough to hold the associated column from the table.
When creating composite primary keys, the datatypes in all columns within the primary key must be of the same datatype.
A column designed to hold data in table must be declared with a datatype large enough to hold values for that column.

q:
In Oracle, which of the following steps is NOT mandatory to open the database in archive log mode?

STEP 1: Shutdown the database, if it is running.

STEP 2: Take a full offline backup.

STEP 3: Set the archiving-related parameters in the parameter file.

STEP 4: Start and mount the database.

Read the following statements:

Step 1) The HR team has given the SELECT Object privilege on EMPLOYEES with GRANT OPTION to John with GRANT OPTION.

Step 2) John grants the SELECT privilege on EMPLOYEE Table to Bob

Step 3)The HR team has revoked the SELECT Object privilege on EMPLOYEE Table from John.

Which of these is correct about the given steps?

a.option: John can grant SELECT privilege to other users
Bob can SELECT data from EMPLOYEE Table
Bob cannot SELECT data from EMPLOYEE Table
Bob can grant SELECT privilege to John User

q: In Oracle, sometimes, no alerts are generated if the actual space usage has reached the specified warning threshold value because ___________________.

a.option: The EVEN parameter was not set
The SQL_TRACE parameter is set to FALSE
The TIMED_STATISTICS parameter is set to FALSE
The STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is set to BASIC

q: In PL/SQL, you are working on the data types. Determine the maximum number of characters for the Single-byte character set?

In PL/SQL, you are working on the collection types. If you are required to assign a value to the collection variables, then which of the following methods can be used in this scenario:
1. Invoke a constructor to create a collection and assign it to the collection variable.
2. Use the assignment statement to assign it to the value of the new collection variable.
3. Pass the value to a subprogram as an OUT or IN OUT parameter, and then assign the value inside the subprogram.

You are working on the data type compatibility of the collections. If the following PL/SQL is executed, which of the following errors are thrown:

DECLARE
        TYPE triplet IS VARRAY(3) OF VARCHAR2(15);
        TYPE trio    IS VARRAY(3) OF VARCHAR2(15);
            group1 triplet := triplet('Alice', 'Bob', 'Tara);
        group2 triplet;
        group3 trio;
BEGIN
        group2 := group1;  
        group3 := group1;  
END;


1. ORA-06550
2. ORA-05260
3. PLS-00382
4. PLS-04520

In PL/SQL, you are working on working on the cursors. Which of the following statements about the implicit cursor are correct:
1. PL/SQL opens an implicit cursor every time you run a SELECT or DML statement.
2. SQLattribute always refers to the least recently run SELECT or DML statement.
3. If no DML is executed, then the value of the SQLattribute is NULL

In PL/SQL, you are working on the collections. If you are required to query a collection, then which of the following conditions must be satisfied:
1. The data type of the collection was either created at a schema level or declared in a package specification.
2. The data type of the collection element is either a dynamic data type, a user-defined type, or a record type.

In PL/SQL, you are working on the cursor variables. If you have assigned a value of the cursor variable VAR1 to another cursor variable VAR2, then which of the following statements in this scenario is correct:
1. If VAR1 is not open, then after the assignment, VAR2 is still open.
2. If VAR1 is open, opening VAR2 after the assignment does not open VAR1.

In PL/SQL, you are processing the query result sets with the subqueries. If you are required to process a query result set by looping through the query and running another query for each row, then which of the following actions must be implemented to improve the query performance:
1. Remove the second query from inside the FOR loop.
2. Include the first query to the FETCH statement.
3. Make the second query as the subquery for the firsts query.

In PL/SQL, which of the following statements about the transaction context in the autonomous transactions are correct:
1. When one autonomous routine invokes another routine, the routines share the transaction context.
2. When an autonomous routine invokes a nonautonomous routine, the routines receive the same transaction context.
vIn PL/SQL, which of the following transactions are used to run multiple queries while other users update the same tables?

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        FUNCTION hackfunction (hackvar NUMBER)   
                RETURN NUMBER                     
        AS                                 
                hackvar1 NUMBER;
        BEGIN                               
                hackvar1 := hackvar * hackvar + hackvar - hackvar * hackvar/hackvar + hackvar * hackvar;
                RETURN hackvar1;          
        END;
BEGIN
        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE(hackfunction(3));  
END;

In PL/SQL, which of the following statements are used in the native dynamic SQL:
1. OPEN
2. FETCH
3. CLOSE

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        TYPE hacktype1 IS TABLE OF DATE   INDEX BY PLS_INTEGER;
        TYPE hacktype2  IS TABLE OF NUMBER INDEX BY PLS_INTEGER;
        hackvar1  hacktype1;
        hackvar2  hacktype2;
        PROCEDURE hackprocedure (tab OUT hacktype2, n INTEGER) IS
        BEGIN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hello world!');
                FOR i IN 1..n LOOP
                        tab(i) := 0.0;
                END LOOP;
        END hackprocedure;
BEGIN
        hackprocedure(hackvar1, 50);
END;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        hackvar NUMBER := 10;
        PROCEDURE p (
                hackvar1 IN NUMBER,
                hackvar2 IN OUT NUMBER,
                hackvar3 IN OUT NOCOPY NUMBER
        ) IS
        BEGIN
                hackvar2 := 20;
                DBMS_OUTPUT.put_line(hackvar1);
                hackvar3 := 30;
                DBMS_OUTPUT.put_line(hackvar1);  
        END;
BEGIN
        p(hackvar, hackvar, hackvar);
        DBMS_OUTPUT.put_line(hackvar);
END;

In PL/SQL, you are working on the exception handling in the triggers. Which of the following scenarios have the database rolls back only the effects of the trigger, but not the effects of the triggering statement:
1. The triggering event is either AFTER STARTUP ON DATABASE or BEFORE SHUTDOWN ON DATABASE.
2. The triggering event is AFTER LOGON ON DATABASE and the user has the SUPER DATABASE TRIGGER privilege.
3. The triggering event is AFTER LOGON ON SCHEMA and the user either owns the schema or has the ALTER ANY TRIGGER privilege.

n PL/SQL, triggers are only used to enforce complex security authorizations that you cannot define using the database security features provided with the database. If a trigger is used to enforce a complex security authorization, it is preferred to use a BEFORE statement trigger. Which of the following statements represents the advantages of using the BEFORE statement trigger in this scenario:
1. The security check is done before the triggering statement is allowed to run such that no wasted work is done by an unauthorized statement.
2. The security check is done only for the triggering statement of each row that is affected by the triggering statement.
In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to create a private database link for the connected user?
In Oracle, which of the following statements about unused columns created by the ALTER TABLE ... SET UNUSED command is incorrect?

a.option: The names of unused columns can be reused.
The disk space occupied by unused columns is not restored.
The unused columns are not displayed in queries or data dictionary views.
All constraints, indexes, and statistics defined on the unused columns are removed.

q: In Oracle, which of the following scripts is used in an Enterprise Manager (EM) to schedule a backup of your database?
In Oracle, which of the following is a mandatory process to perform a backup of a whole database consistently?
In Oracle, which of the following statements about the recovery catalog is correct?

a.option: Recovery catalog is required for any type of backup
Recovery catalog is required for only automatic backups
If the database is in Archive log mode, recovery catalog is not required
If the database is not in Archive log mode, recovery catalog is not required

q:
What is the output of the following PL/SQL code:

DECLARE
        v_employees employees%ROWTYPE;
        CURSOR c1 is SELECT * FROM employees;
BEGIN
        OPEN c1;
        FOR i IN 1..5 LOOP
                FETCH c1 INTO v_employees;
                EXIT WHEN c1%NOTFOUND;
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE ('Hi hackerearth!');
        END LOOP;
        CLOSE c1;
END;

a.option:
Hi hackerearth!
Hi hackerearth!
Hi hackerearth!

Hi hackerearth!
Hi hackerearth!
Hi hackerearth!
Hi hackerearth!

q:
Determine the output of the following code:

DECLARE
        TYPE NumList IS VARRAY(10) OF INTEGER;
        n NumList := NumList(3);
        PROCEDURE hack_procedure IS
        BEGIN
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT('n.COUNT = ' || n.COUNT || ', ');
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('n.LAST = ' || n.LAST);
        END  hack_procedure;
BEGIN
        hack_procedure;
        n.EXTEND(3);
        hack_procedure;
        n.TRIM(5);
        hack_procedure;
END;

Determine the output of the following PL/SQL code:

BEGIN
        DECLARE
                past_due     EXCEPTION;
                due_date     DATE := trunc(SYSDATE) - 1;
                todays_date  DATE := trunc(SYSDATE);
        BEGIN
                IF due_date < todays_date THEN
                        DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hi.');
                        RAISE past_due;
                END IF;
                DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Hello');
        END;
END;

Your database contains a locally managed uniform sized table space with automatic segment space management, which contains only tables. Currently, the uniform size for the table space is 512 K. Because the tables have become so large, your configuration must change to improve performance. Now the tables must reside in a table space that is locally managed, with uniform size of 5 MB and automatic segment-space management. What must you do to meet the new requirements?

a.option: The new requirements cannot be met
Re-create the control file with the correct settings
Create a new table space with correct settings then move the tables into the new table space
